intro: Niederleinia, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its showy, yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plants typically grow in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Niederleinia species are herbaceous perennials with basal rosettes of leaves and elongated stems that bear the flower heads. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
